author: Special Correspondent
text:
The government has extended the special camps to offer micro loans to small vendors affected by the December 2015 floods till February 5.

“The scheme has received immense response and representations have been received by the government from small vendors. Based on the representations, the special camps have been extended for three more days ,” an official release said.

A total of 2.29 lakh applications were received at the 10-day camp since January 22.

As per the scheme announced by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa, small vendors can make use of the special camps to avail themselves of interest-free loans from cooperative banks up to Rs. 5,000, for which the 11 per cent interest would be borne by the State government.

The scheme is open to vendors in flood-affected districts.
title: Special camps for offering micro loans extended
